data.title: Dr. Brimberry's Care Team
data.meta_description: Dr. Matthew Brimberry provides excellent family health care to the Oak Hill area and its surrounding areas.
data.text:
Katie Breihan, FNP-C

After a career as a computer system consultant and real estate agent, Katie developed a passion for medicine. She returned to school and became a critical care nurse at University Medical Center Brackenridge while earning her masters as a Family Nurse Practitioner. Competent in Spanish, she has a special interest in Austin’s Hispanic population and in chronic disease management. Katie enjoys a vibrant household where she, her husband John, and their 3 children often share their home with those in need or in transition.

Care Philosophy:

"Patients and their caregivers are looking for a healthcare partner who cares about them and knows what matters to them. I feel privileged to walk alongside my patients as they travel their unique path of wellness and illness, providing knowledge and judgment and connections. My approach is holistic, listening for insight into the mind-body-spirit influences on a person’s health. With the help of a secure email portal that allows us to stay in touch easily, I can know you and your needs. Together, we will make a plan for you – one that helps you to navigate the complexities of managing an illness, and to achieve optimal health with lifestyle and disease prevention choices."

Accepting New Patients: Yes

Education:

University of Texas at Austin, Bachelors of Arts in International Business, Spanish, and French

Texas Tech University Health Science Center, Bachelor of Science in Nursing

Texas Tech University Health Science Center, Masters of Science in Nursing, Family Nurse Practitioner

Board Certifications:

The American Academy of Nurse Practitioners as a Certified Family Nurse Practitioner

Texas Board of Nursing as an Advanced Practice Registered Nurse with Prescriptive Authority

Affiliations:

American Association of Nurse Practitioners

Texas Nurse Practitioners

Austin Advanced Practice Nurses Organization

Languages other than English: Spanish

Mallory Davis, FNP-C

Mallory was born and raised in Texas and moved to Tyler during college to complete her nursing degree. She attended the University of Texas at Tyler where she obtained a Bachelor of Science. She then moved to Austin and began a position at Seton Medical Center. With a 10-year background in critical care nursing, she completed her Master of Science at the University of Texas at Arlington. She then spent one year in Austin as a Family Nurse Practitioner working with patients suffering from acute illnesses. Mallory is happy to be part of Premier Family Physicians treating patients across the lifespan. She focuses on preventative medicine, clinically working with each patient to prevent chronic or acute illness. Mallory enjoys spending time with her husband and daughter. In her spare time, she enjoys traveling, cooking, and exploring Austin.

Care Philosophy:

"It is always my goal to form strong, healthy relationships with patients and their families. I treat all of my patients equally with dignity and respect. My approach to treatment will include medical and holistic measures to promote a healthy lifestyle. Together, we can form a wellness plan that is specific to your needs. I am dedicated to giving excellent patient-centered care."

Accepting New Patients: Yes

Education:

The University of Texas at Tyler, Bachelor of Science in Nursing

The University of Texas at Arlington, Masters of Science in Nursing

Board Certifications:

The American Academy of Nurse Practitioners as a Certified Family Nurse Practitioner

Nichole Lynch, MSN, APRN, FNP-C - Accepting New Patients

Nichole began her career in medicine as a medical assistant working in gynecology as she worked through nursing school in Fort Myers, Florida. After graduation, she went to work in Pediatric emergency care where she went on to become charge nurse of the year for implementing patient-centered changes in her department. She then went on to obtain her Master’s degree, focusing on Family Primary care while also transitioning to the Adult emergency department. After graduating with her Master’s degree, she began practicing as a Family Nurse Practitioner for Millennium Physician Group, and quickly fell in love with primary care and the intricacies of treating conditions across the lifespan as well as the long-term relationships she gained with her patients and their families. She was also a member of several advocacy groups in Southwest Florida until finally transferring to the Austin area after she and her husband became empty nesters, having successfully raised eight children together.

Care Philosophy:

"Patients need someone who will regard them as a member of their team; someone who truly hears their concerns. I feel fortunate to come alongside patients and their families to develop a treatment plan which aligns with their own values, resources and abilities. My goal is always to support wellness through healthy lifestyle choices; and form authentic connections with the patient and their support system to achieve positive health outcomes together. "

Education:

Chamberlain University, BSN

Chamberlain University, MSN

Board Certifications:

American Academy of Nurse Practitioners

Affiliations:

Board of Directors, Visuality, Inc., Fort Myers LGBTQ+ Community Organizer
